text: The Kartvelian languages are a language family. They are spoken in Georgia. The main language in the family is Georgian. There are two branches of Kartvelian languages: the Karto-Zan languages and the Svan language.Languages of Israel There are around 5.2 million speakers of Kartvelian languages.Dalby (2002), p. 38 ==References== Category:Languages of Asia Category:Languages of Europe
title: Kartvelian languages
